artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Tsujiokaya Kamekichi; Carver: Wada Yūjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 479.1; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 184, p. 290.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: two separate sheets; man at left, pointing, in profile from right, with bare legs, wearing short blue and white garment with brown and black checked short jacket, with a bat-shaped mark on his PR cheek; figure at right with arms drawn into blue checked kimono, wearing a blue and white spotted cloth tied around head and face with only eyes visible; black and white dog, LRC; two pairs of figures at left center in background
dimension: 14 5/16 × 9 7/8 in. (36.35 × 25.08 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban diptych)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Newly Selected Eastern Brocade Prints (Shinsen Azuma nishiki-e 新撰東錦絵)
title: The Story of Otomi and Yosaburō
